responses: Patient Admissions is on the ground floor, north corridor—follow the orange ‘Admissions’ signs.
Please check in at the Admissions desk on Level 0 opposite the main elevators.
Our admitting office is located beside the information desk in the main lobby.
Take the red elevators to the ground floor; Admissions will be on your left after you exit.
For paperwork and insurance verification, the Admissions clerks at the ground‑floor counter will assist you.
If you require help, a volunteer can escort you to the Admissions office.
Arriving after 8 p.m.? Use the Emergency entrance and Security will direct you to after‑hours Admissions.
Admission paperwork and ID verification happen at the desk on Level 0 north side.
Volunteers in orange vests can escort you to Admissions if you prefer.
For insurance updates, step to Window 3 inside the Admissions suite.
If you arrive via the ER, Security will direct you to after‑hours Admissions.
Wheelchair‑accessible counters are available at the Admissions desk.
You can validate parking at Admissions once forms are completed.
Pre‑registered patients can use the self‑service kiosks beside the desk.
Consent forms are signed at the small office behind Admissions Reception.
Interpreter services are available—ask the clerk at Admissions.
Take a ticket from the kiosk and wait for your number to be called.
After check‑in, proceed to the yellow waiting area until transport arrives.

responses: Ambulatory (day) Surgery is on Level 2, west wing—take the purple elevators to floor 2 and follow the ‘Outpatient Surgery’ signs.
Please check in at the Ambulatory Surgery reception desk on 2 West, opposite Pre‑Op.
For same‑day procedures, use Elevator B to Level 2; the unit entrance will be directly ahead.
Families can wait in the Day Surgery lounge on Level 2 next to the recovery bays.
If you parked in Garage A, cross the sky‑bridge to Level 2; Ambulatory Surgery is the first suite on the right.
Need assistance? Volunteers wearing purple badges can escort you to the Ambulatory Surgery Center.
After your procedure, discharge instructions are given at the recovery desk on 2 West.
Pre‑op forms are reviewed at Desk A just inside the Ambulatory Surgery doors.
Recovery bays are located behind the check‑in desk on Level 2 west.
Family updates are posted on the monitor in the Day Surgery lounge.
Locker storage for personal items is available near Pre‑Op.
Patients should arrive 90 minutes early—registration kiosks are outside the unit entrance.
Wheelchair transport can meet you at the skybridge if requested.
Use purple floor stripes from the lobby to reach the surgery center.
Discharge pickup is curbside at the Level 2 roundabout—follow signs for Day Surgery Exit.
If you need directions, volunteers with purple lanyards can guide you.
Anesthesia clinic is adjacent to Ambulatory Surgery reception for last‑minute questions.
Parking validation for day surgery is handled at the reception desk.

responses: Physical Therapy is on Level 1, east wing—follow the green ‘Rehabilitation’ signs from the main lobby.
For outpatient PT, take the blue elevators to Floor 1; the clinic entrance is beside the rehab gym.
Please check in at the Physical Therapy reception desk on 1 East.
The therapy gym is located directly behind the PT reception; staff will guide you after you sign in.
If you need equipment fitting, the assistive‑device room is within the PT suite on Level 1.
Volunteer escorts in green vests can accompany you to Physical Therapy if needed.
Patients with mobility challenges may use the accessible entrance on Level 1 via the east ramp.
Follow green footprints on the floor to reach the Rehab gym on Level 1 east.
Hydrotherapy pool is two doors past the PT reception desk.
Sports rehab services are in the same suite—ask the clerk for directions.
OT and PT share a waiting area; check‑in tablets are on the right.
Early‑morning patients may enter via the east ramp before main doors open.
Adaptive equipment shop is next to the therapy gym for walker fittings.
Volunteer escorts in green shirts can walk you to the PT clinic.
Neuro‑rehab PT rooms are labeled N1‑N5 down the rear hallway.
Family can observe therapy through the viewing window beside Room 3.
Please arrive 10 minutes early to complete exercise screening forms.
If elevators are busy, stairs opposite Radiology also reach Level 1 PT.

responses: Yes, free Wi‑Fi is available throughout the hospital. Choose the network ‘TRH‑Guest’ and accept the terms to connect—no password required.
Select the ‘TRH‑Guest’ network on your device, open a browser, and tap ‘Accept’ on the welcome page.
If your connection drops, try toggling Wi‑Fi off and on or moving closer to a hallway access point.
Guest Wi‑Fi is open and unencrypted; avoid accessing sensitive accounts unless you use a VPN.
Wi‑Fi speeds support basic browsing and video calls but may slow during peak times.
Need help? Call the IT Service Desk at extension 4444, or ask a volunteer to assist.
Staff have a separate secure network. Visitors should use ‘TRH‑Guest’ for internet access.
Connect to ‘TRH‑Guest’, open a browser, and tap ‘Accept’—no password needed.
If the splash page doesn’t appear, visit any non‑secure site to trigger it.
Signal is strongest near hallways; interior rooms may see slower speeds.
Bandwidth supports video calls but may throttle large downloads.
Need help? Call IT at ext 4444 or visit the Tech Help Desk in the lobby.
Guest Wi‑Fi is not encrypted; consider using a VPN for sensitive tasks.
You can connect up to three devices per patient room.
Streaming services function, but quality may drop during peak hours.
Wired ports are available in select rooms—ask your nurse for a cable.
Staff network uses WPA2; guests must stay on ‘TRH‑Guest’.
There is no data cap, but idle devices may be disconnected after 4 hours.

responses: Today's lunch specials include grilled chicken with quinoa, vegetable lasagna (vegetarian), and tomato basil soup.
The cafeteria rotates menus daily; you can view the full list on the digital board at the entrance or via the QR code posted on each table.
Vegetarian, vegan, gluten‑free, and halal options are available every day—just ask the server for details.
Breakfast is served 6 a.m.–10 a.m.; the grill reopens for lunch at 11 a.m. and closes at 2 p.m.
Coffee, tea, and grab‑and‑go snacks are available all day near the cashier.
Friday features baked fish with lemon herb rice, plus a chef’s salad bar and minestrone soup.
If you have dietary restrictions, let the cafeteria staff know—they can suggest suitable items.
Weekly menus are posted online—scan the QR code by the cafeteria doors.
Today’s vegan entrée is roasted vegetable quinoa bowl.
Gluten‑free bread is available at the sandwich station—ask the chef.
Halal chicken shawarma is featured at lunch until 2 p.m.
Soup rotation lists tomato basil, chicken noodle, and lentil today.
Breakfast burritos are served until 10 a.m.; grill reopens 11 a.m.
Price for salad bar is $7.99 per pound; small bowl discount available.
Low‑sodium options are labeled with a green heart icon on the board.
Kids’ meals come with fruit cup and milk for $5.
Nutritional information is printed above each hot entrée.
Menu changes slightly on weekends—check the board for updated specials.
